alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:29PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Douglas, east central Chelan, central Adams, southwestern Lincoln, southern Okanogan and northeastern Grant Counties through 315 PM PDT... At 229 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles southeast of Chelan to near Cascade Valley to 8 miles south of Connell. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moses Lake, Ephrata, Othello, Chelan, Warden, Moses Lake North, Lakeview, Banks Lake South, Cascade Valley, Soap Lake, Odessa, Lind, Coulee City, Mansfield, Wilson Creek, Hartline, Hatton, Krupp, Batum, and Irby. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 177 and 219. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 155 and 209. U.S. Highway 97 in Washington between mile markers 238 and 251. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 62 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
